Text: Customer support is awesome the product is horrible
The project management was flawless. Our dedicated manager, Alex, was always on top of things and communication was crystal clear. A bit pricey, but worth every penny for the peace of mind.
We are extremely disappointed with the technical skills of the junior developers assigned to us. The code was buggy and required constant oversight from our in-house team.
Their support team is incredibly responsive. We had a critical issue over the weekend and they had it resolved within two hours. Truly impressive.
The final product was delivered on time and met all our specifications. Solid work from a reliable team.
Billing is a complete mess. We were overcharged for hours that were not worked, and getting it corrected has been a nightmare.
The developers are technically brilliant, but their project manager seems completely overwhelmed. Deadlines were missed repeatedly due to poor planning.
Good value for the price. The quality isn't top-tier, but for our budget, it's more than acceptable. You get what you pay for.
They promised expertise in cloud migration, but their team was clearly learning on the job. The project was delayed by two months and went over budget.
The platform they provided for tracking progress is intuitive and a huge help. It makes collaboration seamless.
I'm giving three stars because the developers are skilled, but the communication from the management team is severely lacking. We often felt in the dark about progress.
A fantastic partner for our startup. They understood our vision and delivered a high-quality MVP well within our tight deadline.
The time zone difference was a much bigger issue than we anticipated. Getting timely responses to urgent questions was a constant struggle.
Their QA process needs a serious overhaul. We found so many obvious bugs in the final delivery that it felt like it wasn't tested at all.
The initial consultation was amazing. They really took the time to understand our business needs before proposing a solution.
While the project was successful, the constant upselling was exhausting. Every call felt like a new sales pitch for another service.
Technically, the work is fine. But their team shows zero proactivity. They only do exactly what is asked and never suggest improvements.
We've been working with them for over two years now, and they've become an indispensable part of our team. Highly recommend.
The lead developer we worked with, Maria, was a rockstar. Her expertise in AI was a game-changer for our project.
The cost savings are significant, but be prepared to invest a lot of your own time in managing the project and clarifying requirements.
They completely missed the deadline for our critical launch, and the communication leading up to the failure was poor. We can't trust them again.
Their ability to scale the team up or down based on our needs has been incredibly valuable for our fluctuating workload.
The code quality is excellent. It's clean, well-documented, and follows best practices. Our internal team was very impressed.
Customer support is friendly, but they don't seem empowered to solve problems. Every issue has to be escalated, causing delays.
The project was a disaster from start to finish. Poor communication, missed deadlines, and a buggy final product.
Their pricing is transparent and fair. No hidden fees or surprises, which we really appreciate.
The team is eager and hardworking, but lacks the senior-level experience we needed for a complex architectural project.
They did a great job on the UI/UX design. The app they delivered is beautiful and a pleasure to use.
It feels like we're working with a black box. We send requirements, and code comes back, but there's no collaboration or discussion.
For basic website maintenance, they are a cost-effective and reliable choice. No complaints.
They assigned a new project manager halfway through, and the transition was chaotic. It completely derailed our progress.
The security audit they performed on our application was incredibly thorough and identified several critical vulnerabilities. Great work.
Their English proficiency was a barrier. Technical details were often lost in translation, leading to rework.
A truly agile team. They adapted to our changing requirements without any fuss and delivered great results.
The project started strong but lost momentum. It feels like our project was de-prioritized in favor of other clients.
We were promised a team of senior developers, but the code we received suggests otherwise. Very disappointed in the bait-and-switch.
The onboarding process was seamless. We were up and running with our new team in less than a week.
Their expertise in legacy system modernization saved us from a complete rewrite. They know their stuff.
The contract negotiation was painful and rigid. They were not willing to accommodate any of our standard clauses.
I'm impressed by their commitment to quality. They have a rigorous code review and testing process that caught issues early.
They are great at execution but lack strategic input. We were hoping for a partner, not just a team of coders.
The project was a huge success and delivered under budget. Management is very happy. We will be using them for future projects.
Turnover on their team is high. We've had three different lead developers in six months, which has been disruptive.
Their documentation is top-notch. It makes handing over the project to our internal team so much easier.
The initial estimates were way off. The project ended up costing nearly double what was quoted.
They are very process-oriented, which brings a level of predictability and stability that we appreciate.
The team seems burnt out. The quality of work and communication has noticeably declined over the past few months.
An excellent choice for staff augmentation. The developers they provided integrated perfectly with our existing team.
Their legal and compliance team was a nightmare to work with. It slowed down the project start by over a month.
They went above and beyond to help us meet a critical investor deadline. We couldn't have done it without them.
